intro: Pseuduvaria galeata, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers and oval-shaped, glossy leaves. Its fruits are typically small berries that turn red when mature. Pseuduvaria galeata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
